solution_line_template: A milk tea shop sold {total_sales} x {winter_melon_fraction} = <<{total_sales}*{winter_melon_fraction}={winter_melon_sales}>>{winter_melon_sales} cups of winter melon-flavored milk tea.
They sold {total_sales} x {okinawa_fraction} = <<{total_sales}*{okinawa_fraction}={okinawa_sales}>>{okinawa_sales} cups of Okinawa-flavored milk tea.

So they sold a total of {winter_melon_sales} + {okinawa_sales} = <<{winter_melon_sales}+{okinawa_sales}={total_winter_melon_okinawa_sales}>>{total_winter_melon_okinawa_sales} cups of winter melon and Okinawa flavors milk tea.
Therefore, they sold {total_sales} - {total_winter_melon_okinawa_sales} = <<{total_sales}-{total_winter_melon_okinawa_sales}={chocolate_sales}>>{chocolate_sales} cups of chocolate-flavored milk tea.
